content.raw:
I've been testing the `FreeGroup` feature in ign-gazebo. I think `SetPose` and `SetVelocity` work pretty well if the model only has one free group. 

**Set pose repeatedly:**

![resized.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/5q9rMzd/images/808586229-resized.gif)

**Set angular velocity**

![setangvel_resized.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/5q9rMzd/images/1968619923-setangvel_resized.gif)

For a model with two free links, i.e. two free groups, the `SetPose` works if the links are at rest. 

**Set pose repeatedly:**

![setpose.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/5q9rMzd/images/4183667358-setpose.gif)

**Set angular velocity**

![angular_vel.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/5q9rMzd/images/330325357-angular_vel.gif)

If you want to try it out, checkout the` move_entity` branch of ign-gazebo, build, and run the example in `example/worlds/move_entity.sdf`. The move-entity system subscribes to a `cmd_pose` and `cmd_vel` for each model and link. Once the simulation starts, you can run the following commands:

* For commanding pose on a model `ign topic -t "/model/box/cmd_pose" -m ignition.msgs.Pose -p "position: {y: 1.0 z: 2.5}"`
* For commanding velocity on a model `ign topic -t "/model/box/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 0 y: 1.0 z: 2.5} angular: {z: 1}"`
* For commanding pose on a link `ign topic -t "/model/box/link/box_link/cmd_pose" -m ignition.msgs.Pose -p "position: {y: 1.0 z: 2.5}"`
* For commanding velocity on a model `ign topic -t "/model/box/link/box_link/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 0 y: 1.0 z: 2.5} angular: {z: 1}"`
